Hey friends once somebody told me, when a
child is born a mother is born. And that means

a woman gives birth to a child and a child
gives birth to a mother. Today’s lesson

is dedicated to all the wonderful mothers
out there and yes, it is because it is mother’s
day. So in today’s lesson, we are going to take a look at some idioms using the word mother in it.

So let’s start, my first one
here is, At your mother’s knee. Now when

I use this idiom, I mean, you’ll learn something
when you were a child. So the other day, I

went out with my friends and one of my friends
sang really well. And I said, Wow! Have you

trained professionally? And she said no, I
learn to sing at my mother’s knee, so when

she said that, it meant she learnt to sing,
when she was young. Now imagine, why do we

use mothers knee? We use it to say, when a
child is young, we generally learn our first

things, the first words from our mother, Right?
She’s the first teacher in your life. So

that is how this idiom came, At your mothers
knee, so well for me, I’ve learnt to speak

English at my mother’s knee. She’s the
person, who taught me and made me confident

to speak English. So remember the idiom, At
your mothers knee means, you learnt something,

when you were that young. So when you want
to say you learnt something, when you were

really young or when you were a child, go
ahead and say, I learnt it at my mother’s

knee. The next one, Experience is the mother
of wisdom. Well, it’s very clear, so basically

people learn from what happens to them. So
maybe you experience things and it teaches

you a lesson and of course you grow wiser
by the day, so when we say experience is the

mother of wisdom. That means experience gives
birth to wisdom and so we call it the mother

of wisdom. Now again, why do we use mother
here? It shows that it gives birth to a new

quality called wisdom. So when I say, experience
is the mother of wisdom. I mean probably I

have learnt something from what has happened
to me in my life. Now sometimes we really

fight with our mothers or our parents, Right?
We get angry and we really don’t understand

things from their perspective, so I can make
a sentence and say, you will never understand

your parents love for you until you have your
own children. So experience is the mother

of wisdom, so till you don’t experience
it, you would never know and when you do the

learning begins there. Well, friends, so that
is why to make this very profound or with

a deep meaning, we use the word mother and
this idiom means, you learn from what happens

in your life. So your experience makes you
wiser. The next one, Face that only a mother

could love. Well, honestly I think, you should
not use this idiom, because it’s got a very

rude meaning and that means someone, who has
a very ugly face. So the other day I overheard

a guy tell a girl, I don’t even like your
friend, look at her she’s so unattractive.

She’s got a face that only a mother could
love. Now this is something really rude. You

do not condemn someone’s look by saying
it, because if you use this idiom, it means

that the person has an ugly face. Now again
if you see, we’ve used the word mother over

here, because it is only a mother, who can
love a child beyond the physicality’s or

the looks or the character, the features and
the nature of that person. Because that’s

her child, she will never judge her child
and that is why we use this in an idiom to

say that a person is so ugly. Nobody is going
to love the person except his or her mother.

So friends remember do not use this idiom,
but yes when you hear people use it, you should

know what it means. It’s very rude, it’s
very mean, so please do not use it. The next

one, He that would the daughter win. Now this
is a bit different, it’s a proverb, he that

would the daughter win, must with the mother
first begin. Well, now this idiom is especially

for all the guys out there, who want to marry
their lady love, but remember it is important

to win the heart of their mothers first. So
well to get approval from the girl’s mother,

you need to be impressive, you need to get
her on your side and gain the confidence that

you are, Mr Perfect for her charming daughter.
So we say, he that would the daughter win,

must with the mother first begin. Now well
my friend Joe, he is madly in love with his

girlfriend Maria and he intends marrying her.
They’ve been dating for a while now, but

the other day I told him Joe, It’s not so
easy, you need to kind of impress Marias mother

get her on your side and then well maybe things
will go smoothly for you. And then I said,

he that would the daughter win, must with
the mother first begin. Basically it sounds

very complicated, but the meaning is simple.
You need to win over the girl’s mother first,

win over her heart, get her to like you and
well then the girl automatically comes to

you, so this is what the idiom means. So all
the guys out there, pull up your socks, be

impressive, go ahead and impress the girl’s
mother first and everything else will come

to you easy. So all the guys out there, who
are struggling with this, all the best to

you. The next one, Like mother, like daughter.
Well, this is something very simple, we hear

it all the time. Now imagine if a child has
some similar traits like his mother, it could

be behaviour, nature, it could be dressing
style, it could be food habits. We say, Oh

like mother, like child. Sometimes we say,
Like mother, like daughter, Like mother, like

son. What we mean to say is he is ditto, ditto
or exactly like his or her mother. Now imagine,

Oh well, I have to tell you this , my little
cousin she is very calm by nature , she is

oblivious to everything that’s happening
around her and I wonder, How? She’s very

calm, she stays calm and anything happens,
she just doesn’t get affected , I really

don’t know how? So whenever I see her, I
realize, she’s gone on her mom, because

my aunt is identically the same or rather
she is identical to her mom. So I always tell

her, Nancy you’re so calm, Like mother,
like daughter. Something similar that you

have to your mother. So that is when we say,
Like mother, like daughter , Like mother,

like son. The next one, Necessity is the mother
of invention. Now see again we have the word

mother here. You know this idiom is very common
and people say it when they want to express

that when you need to do something, you will
find a way to do it. Anyhow so when you need

to do something, you will do it, so that means
necessity is the mother of invention. I’m

gonna give you an example, The other day my
friend was rushing out of her house and she

had to leave a post aid note on her refrigerator
for her husband. And her cell phone had died

off, her battery died down and she needed
to leave a message, so she took a post aid

and she started writing only to realize her
pen went out of ink. So what she did was very

smart. Well, mother of invention, she removed
her lipstick and just scribbled two words

and left the note on the fridge. That means
she had to leave the message, she did it anyhow.

So necessity, when you need something, you
will find a way to do it. And you know how

you’ll find a way? Mother of invention,
that means somehow you will think and you

will invent a new idea. That’s why we use
the word mother, because it’s the mother

of invention. It gives birth to a new thought,
to a new invention. So this idiom means people

will do, when they need to do something, they
will do it, come what may. They will find

a way, they will find a solution, they will
find an alternative manner of doing it. So

remember, necessity is the mother of invention,
so we do know and we can find our ways, if

we have to do something. Well, the last one,
Mother of all. When I say, mother of all.

Again we have the word mother here. I mean
to say the most impressive or maybe the most

important of its kind or type. Like nothing
beyond this, very very important. Well, so

let me tell you one sentence with this, Failure
is the mother of all success. So without failure,

you can’t succeed, because when you fail,
you pick yourself up, you struggle and there

you have success your way. So that means failure
is the mother of all success. It is the most

important part, when you or your most important
aspect to getting success. Now supposing I

have this, I have a colleague of mine, who
speaks really well at conferences and she

somehow doesn’t leave the stage without
getting an applause. So whenever she comes

to our office, we are like, Wow! Here she
comes, the mother of all presentator, presenters.

So what I mean to say is nobody can beat her,
she’s the best and the most important of

its types. She does a great job and of course
not to forget, very impressive. So that is

when you say, the mother of all. So these
are a few idioms, where we use the word mother

in them to show the profoundness or the meaning
of something you want to say, because all

of us know what the word mother means and
how deep it is. So go ahead and use these

idioms in your daily conversation. And well
to all the mothers out there, once again,

I wish you a very happy mother’s day. Thank
you for being the epitome of strength and

setting examples for all the children out
there and well specially to my mom. I love

you and I wish you a very happy mother’s
day. I’m going to be back with a new lesson.
Till then take care and bye.
